title: Skill pure

properties.name: description
properties.value: A Skill pure, or level 3 Skiller, is a type of pure that only develops non-combat skills. Level 3 skillers keep their Combat skills at level 1, leaving their combat level at 3. This makes it challenging to gain levels, as some regions of Gielinor have high-damage dealing monsters to be wary of, and some simply require quests with combat involved.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Skill pure
Skill pure
MembersNo
Also calledSkiller
Build typeSkiller
Combat level3
Example combat stats
101111113

A Skill pure, or level 3 Skiller, is a type of pure that only develops non-combat skills. Level 3 skillers keep their Combat skills at level 1, leaving their combat level at 3. This makes it challenging to gain levels, as some regions of Gielinor have high-damage dealing monsters to be wary of, and some simply require quests with combat involved.

Skill pures are recommended to equip a bow without wielding any ammo, to prevent the account from engaging in combat. Bows available to skill pures include the training bow, standard bow, standard crossbow, rain bow, cursed goblin bow, and the phoenix crossbow. The training bow is particulary useful for this purpose because it can only fire training arrows, which are exclusively obtained from the ranged tutor. Also, skill pures are advised to set attack options on both players and monsters in the options tab to hidden. This is to prevent gaining any Combat experience in the event that a monster is accidentally attacked.

This is a challenging way to compete with the rest, and is seen among level 3s as being really rewarding!

The best gloves a level 3 skiller can get are steel gloves, as other Recipe for Disaster subquests require killing monsters or getting combat experience.

Quests[edit | edit source]

The following quests can be completed by Skill pures as they do not reward the player with any experience points in skills that would raise the character's combat level. Some quests require food and rings of recoil.

Finishing all of these quests would require the skill levels in the box to the right.

Total level: 338

1 25 1

1 1 36
1 1 30
34 27
3 44 ----

Notes (quests)[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Quest completion is possible without gaining any combat experience. Using a Pickaxe and having 10 Mining will allow you to kill the Ancient Guardian without combat.
  2. ^ F2P quest completion is not possible; however, P2P and Ironman quest completion is possible without gaining any combat experience. Rings of recoil can be used to kill Ithoi the Navigator. He has a very fast hitpoints regeneration requiring 3-4 rings of recoil. An alternative, Ironman friendly, method to completing the quest is to flinch Ithoi with a karambwan paste or weapon poison(++) poisoned weapon. Ithoi provides reduced experience granting you 0 combat experience when successfully hitting 1s. Due to his very fast hitpoints regeneration he must be poisoned twice.
  3. ^ Quest completion is possible without gaining any combat experience. When fighting Delrith, you only need to attack the demon once with the Silverlight to gain his aggression [It is recommended to equip a Berserker Necklace and lower your attack and strength to 0 which will reduce the chance of getting combat experience when gaining aggression as dealing damage is not required]. Rings of recoil can then be used to kill the demon. The final hit does NOT have to be dealt by the Silverlight. IRONMAN METHOD -- The quest is completable; however, you WILL gain combat experience. You will need kill the demon with the Silverlight.
  4. ^ In Shield of Arrav, it is recommended that you join the Black Arm Gang, because though a level 30 weaponsmaster must be killed to retrieve the Phoenix crossbows, you may enlist the help of another player to kill him for you.
  5. ^ It is not necessary to deal any damage apart from using rings of recoil to kill the Mourner.
  6. ^ In Cold War, exiting the cage with icelords gives 40 Attack experience. This is not required for unlocking the Penguin agility course.
  7. ^ You will need rings of recoil to kill the Sand Snake.
  8. ^ Though it is possible to kill the Earth elemental with rings of recoil, you will not get the ore from him unless (at minimum) a single point of damage is inflicted.
  9. ^ It is not necessary to deal any damage apart from using rings of recoil to kill the Tough Guy and Bandit Champion.
  10. ^ In Hazeel Cult, you must choose Hazeel's side to prevent combat.
  11. ^ In Lost City, you must kill a Dramen Tree Spirit. It is encouraged to bring a friend or to use rings of recoil until the spirit is nearly dead, and then deal a point of damage (Ranged is recommended, as you can attack it from cover), followed by recoiling it to death.
  12. ^ In Observatory Quest, the constellation may give Combat experience. If this happens, simply refrain from talking to the professor.
  13. ^ One Small Favour is possible with the help of high level friends
  14. ^ Only the beginning, Dwarf, Goblin General, and Pirate Pete subquests are able to be completed as a skiller.
  15. ^ The quest itself awards no experience, but talking to the three brothers afterwards will give 5k Cooking, 5k Fishing, and 2.5k Attack and Strength experience. Do not talk to Tamayu if you wish to avoid the Attack and Strength rewards.
  16. ^ Though the quest itself is able to be completed without increasing Combat experience, the after-quest minigame, Tears of Guthix, is not advised as it rewards experience in your lowest skill.

Achievement diaries[edit | edit source]

These following easy Achievement Diaries can be completed by a skill pure whilst keeping combat level 3. Please note that the 0 combat experience methods typically require alt accounts especially when using spawn manipulation. Methods are outlined for individuals without alt accounts; however, they may require more combat experience to be gained.

  • Ardougne Diary [0 XP Method] [Diary 1]
  • Desert Diary [Combat XP] [Diary 2]
  • Falador Diary [0 XP Method] [Diary 3]
  • Kandarin Diary [0 XP Method] [Diary 4]
  • Karamja Diary [0 XP Method] [Diary 5]
  • Lumbridge & Draynor Diary [0 XP Method] [Diary 6]
  • Varrock Diary
  • Kourend & Kebos Diary [Combat XP] [Diary 7]

Notes (diaries)[edit | edit source]

  1. ^ Ardougne Diary (Easy) completion is possible without gaining any combat experience. The "Enter the Combat Training Camp north of West Ardougne" task requires the completion of Biohazard. Biohazard requires you to kill a mourner to receive a key. Rings of recoil can be used to kill the mourner and no "true" damage is required. An alternative, Ironman friendly, method to kill the mourner requires dialogue manipulation and 1 alt account. Note: Your alt account cannot have Biohazard complete.
  2. ^ Desert Diary (Easy) completion REQUIRES combat experience. The "Kill a vulture" task can be completed using a Dwarf Multicannon and spawn manipulation granting 0 range experience (the use of 1 alt account is required; however, multiple are recommended). An alternative method is simply hit the vulture for 1 "true" damage (gaining minimal combat experience) and recoiling. Note: The vulture is immune to both poison and venom. Also, the "Open the sarcophagus in the first room of Pyramid Plunder" task grants 20 strength experience.
  3. ^ Falador Diary (Easy) completion is possible without gaining any combat experience. The "Kill a duck in Falador Park" task can be completed using a Dwarf Multicannon and spawn manipulation granting 0 range experience. This method requires 1 alt account and killing the western most Duck in the pond is preferred for this method. An alternative method is simply using a ranged weapon or halberd to kill the duck granting combat experience.
  4. ^ Kandarin Diary (Easy) completion is possible without gaining any combat experience. The "Defeat one of each elemental in the Elemental Workshop" task can be completed using a Dwarf Multicannon and spawn manipulation granting 0 range experience (the use of 1 alt account is required; however, multiple are recommended). You can then use rings of recoil for the elemental's remaining hitpoints. An alternative, Ironman friendly, method to kill the elementals includes spawn manipulation using a Dwarf Multicannon and then using an alt account to apply poison through the use of emerald bolts (e). Emerald bolts (e) have of the ability of the Magical Poison effect triggering on a successful 0 hit. A third alternative method is simply hit each elemental for 1 "true" damage (gaining minimal combat experience) and recoiling/poisoning. Note: You cannot leave the Elemental Workshop or your progress will be reset.
  5. ^ Karamja Diary (Easy) completion is possible without gaining any combat experience. The "Kill a jogre in the Pothole Dungeon" task can be completed using a Dwarf Multicannon and spawn manipulation granting 0 range experience (the use of 1 alt account is required; however, multiple are recommended). You can then use rings of recoil for the jogre's remaining hitpoints. An alternative, Ironman friendly, method to kill the jogre includes spawn manipulation using a Dwarf Multicannon and then using an alt account to apply poison through the use of emerald bolts (e). Emerald bolts (e) have of the ability of the Magical Poison effect triggering on a successful 0 hit. Ironman are recommended to keep the jogre bones for Tai Bwo Wannai Trio. A third alternative method is simply hit the jogre for 1 "true" damage (gaining minimal combat experience) and recoiling/poisoning.
  6. ^ Lumbridge & Draynor Diary (Easy) completion is possible without gaining any combat experience. The "Slay a cave bug in the Lumbridge Swamp Caves" task can be completed using a Dwarf Multicannon and spawn manipulation granting 0 range experience (the use of 1 alt account is required; however, multiple are recommended). Cave bugs have a very fast hitpoints regeneration and will need to be killed in a single shot. Rings of recoil and poison are not recommended. The "Kill a zombie in the Draynor Sewers" task can also be completed using a Dwarf Multicannon and spawn manipulation. You can then use rings of recoil for the zombie's remaining hitpoints. An alternative, Ironman friendly, method to kill the zombie includes spawn manipulation using a Dwarf Multicannon and then using an alt account to apply poison through the use of emerald bolts (e). Emerald bolts (e) have of the ability of the Magical Poison effect triggering on a successful 0 hit. Note: When using a Dwarf Multicannon it is recommended to kill a zombie in the southern most room. A third alternative method is simply hit the zombie for 1 (gaining minimal combat experience) and recoiling/poisoning.
  7. ^ Kourend & Kebos Diary (Easy) completion REQUIRES combat experience. The "Kill a sand crab" task cannot be completed using spawn manipulation and requires 1 "true" damage. Sand crabs have 60 hitpoints and despawn very quickly (after 2-3 minutes) making them rather hard to kill with just rings of recoil. It is recommended to use an alt account with a Toxic Blowpipe and Serpentine Helm (Range level reduced to 0-2 with Saradomin Brews) to hit a 1 inflicting venom. The sand crab will then need to regenerate it's hitpoints to full before the venom damage registers (resetting kill credit). Once the sand crabs hitpoints are full, do 1 "true" damage with the Skill Pure (gaining minimal combat experience) while the venom finishes the kill. Note: If the venom registers before the sand crab regenerates it's hitpoints to full just start the process over. An alternative method is to use a poisoned weapon to hit the sand crab for 1 (gaining minimal combat experience) and recoiling. Note: This method requires the poison to take effect.

Minigames[edit | edit source]

There are also certain activities a skill pure can do. Activities listed below are possible to play whilst keeping Combat at level 3.

  • Barbarian Assault
  • Blast Mine
  • Blast Furnace
  • Burthorpe Games Room
  • Brimhaven Agility Arena
  • Castle Wars
  • Clan Wars
  • Duel Arena
  • Fishing Trawler
  • Gnome Restaurant
  • Guardians of the Rift
  • Last Man Standing
  • The Motherlode Mine
  • Pyramid plunder
  • Rogues' Den
  • Rogue Trader
  • Sorceress's Garden
  • Tithe Farm
  • Treasure Trails
  • TzHaar Fight Cave
  • Wintertodt
  • Tempoross

Notes (activities)[edit | edit source]

Ironman skillers can also participate in the TzHaar Fight Pit.

Strategies[edit | edit source]

Certain non-combat skills help skill pures in Combat, specifically defending. These skills are extremely helpful and recommended to be trained.

Skill Uses
Slayer Gives access to more equipment. (The bug lantern is unlocked at 33 Slayer.)
Agility Reduces energy usage rate, for quests with monsters on paths.

Some skill pures also have a set-up when doing quests or activities involving combat. Here's a common one that keeps the items up to three to prevent losing items.

Slot(s) Equipment used
Main hand Any bow (without ammo, prevents combat)
Boots Boots of lightness (reduces weight)
All but weapon, shield, ring slots Graceful outfit (reduces weight, set effect increases run energy restore rate)
Ring Ring of recoil (deals damage to enemies)

A '''Skill pure''', or '''level 3''' '''Skiller''', is a type of [[pure]] that only develops non-combat [[skills]]. Level 3 skillers keep their [[Combat]] skills at level 1, leaving their [[combat level]] at 3. This makes it challenging to gain levels, as some regions of [[Gielinor]] have high-damage dealing [[monsters]] to be wary of, and some simply require quests with combat involved.

Skill pures are recommended to equip a [[bow]] ''without'' wielding any [[ammo]], to prevent the account from engaging in combat. Bows available to skill pures include the [[training bow]], [[shortbow|standard bow]], [[Crossbow|standard crossbow]], [[rain bow]], [[cursed goblin bow]], and the [[phoenix crossbow]]. The training bow is particulary useful for this purpose because it can only fire [[training arrows]], which are exclusively obtained from the [[Ranged combat tutor|ranged tutor]]. Also, skill pures are advised to set [[attack options]] on both players and monsters in the [[options]] tab to ''hidden''. This is to prevent gaining any Combat [[experience]] in the event that a monster is accidentally attacked.

This is a challenging way to compete with the rest, and is seen among level 3s as being really rewarding!

The best [[gloves]] a level 3 skiller can get are [[steel gloves]], as other [[Recipe for Disaster]] subquests require killing monsters or getting combat experience.

==Quests==
The following [[quests]] can be completed by Skill pures as they do not reward the player with any experience points in skills that would raise the character's combat level. Some quests require [[food]] and [[rings of recoil]].

Finishing all of these quests would require the skill levels in the box to the right.

==Achievement diaries==
These following easy [[Achievement Diaries]] can be completed by a skill pure whilst keeping [[combat level]] 3. Please note that the 0 combat experience methods typically require [[alt account]]s especially when using spawn manipulation. Methods are outlined for individuals without alt accounts; however, they may require more combat experience to be gained. 

*[[Ardougne Diary]] [0 [[XP]] Method] <ref group="Diary">[[Ardougne Diary]] (Easy) completion is possible without gaining any combat experience. The "Enter the [[Combat Training Camp]] north of [[West Ardougne]]" task requires the completion of [[Biohazard]]. Biohazard requires you to kill a [[mourner]] to receive a [[Key (Biohazard)|key]]. [[Rings of recoil]] can be used to kill the mourner and no "true" damage is required. An alternative, Ironman friendly, method to kill the mourner requires dialogue manipulation and 1 [[alt account]]. ''Note: Your alt account cannot have Biohazard complete.''</ref>

*[[Desert Diary]] [Combat [[XP]]]  <ref group="Diary">[[Desert Diary]] (Easy) completion REQUIRES combat experience. The "Kill a [[vulture]]" task can be completed using a [[Dwarf Multicannon]] and spawn manipulation granting 0 [[range]] experience (the use of 1 [[alt account]] is required; however, multiple are recommended). An alternative method is simply hit the vulture for 1 "true" damage (gaining minimal combat experience) and recoiling. ''Note: The vulture is immune to both [[poison]] and [[venom]].'' Also, the "Open the sarcophagus in the first room of [[Pyramid Plunder]]" task grants 20 [[strength]] experience.</ref>

*[[Falador Diary]] [0 [[XP]] Method] <ref group="Diary">[[Falador Diary]] (Easy) completion is possible without gaining any combat experience. The "Kill a [[duck]] in [[Falador Park]]" task can be completed using a [[Dwarf Multicannon]] and spawn manipulation granting 0 [[range]] experience. This method requires 1 [[alt account]] and killing the western most Duck in the pond is preferred for this method. An alternative method is simply using a [[ranged weapon]] or [[halberd]] to kill the duck granting combat experience.</ref>

*[[Kandarin Diary]] [0 [[XP]] Method] <ref group="Diary">[[Kandarin Diary]] (Easy) completion is possible without gaining any combat experience. The "Defeat one of each [[elemental]] in the [[Elemental Workshop]]" task can be completed using a [[Dwarf Multicannon]] and spawn manipulation granting 0 [[range]] experience (the use of 1 [[alt account]] is required; however, multiple are recommended). You can then use [[rings of recoil]] for the elemental's remaining hitpoints. An alternative, Ironman friendly, method to kill the elementals includes spawn manipulation using a Dwarf Multicannon and then using an alt account to apply [[poison]] through the use of [[emerald bolts (e)]]. Emerald bolts (e) have of the ability of the [[Magical Poison]] effect triggering on a successful 0 hit. A third alternative method is simply hit each elemental for 1 "true" damage (gaining minimal combat experience) and recoiling/poisoning. ''Note: You cannot leave the Elemental Workshop or your progress will be reset.''</ref>

*[[Karamja Diary]] [0 [[XP]] Method] <ref group="Diary">[[Karamja Diary]] (Easy) completion is possible without gaining any combat experience. The "Kill a [[jogre]] in the [[Pothole Dungeon]]" task can be completed using a [[Dwarf Multicannon]] and spawn manipulation granting 0 [[range]] experience (the use of 1 [[alt account]] is required; however, multiple are recommended). You can then use [[rings of recoil]] for the jogre's remaining hitpoints. An alternative, Ironman friendly, method to kill the jogre includes spawn manipulation using a Dwarf Multicannon and then using an alt account to apply [[poison]] through the use of [[emerald bolts (e)]]. Emerald bolts (e) have of the ability of the [[Magical Poison]] effect triggering on a successful 0 hit. Ironman are recommended to keep the [[jogre bones]] for [[Tai Bwo Wannai Trio]]. A third alternative method is simply hit the jogre for 1 "true" damage (gaining minimal combat experience) and recoiling/poisoning.</ref> 

*[[Lumbridge & Draynor Diary]] [0 [[XP]] Method] <ref group="Diary">[[Lumbridge & Draynor Diary]] (Easy) completion is possible without gaining any combat experience. The "Slay a [[cave bug]] in the [[Lumbridge Swamp Caves]]" task can be completed using a [[Dwarf Multicannon]] and spawn manipulation granting 0 [[range]] experience (the use of 1 [[alt account]] is required; however, multiple are recommended). Cave bugs have a very fast [[hitpoints]] regeneration and will need to be killed in a single shot. [[Rings of recoil]] and [[poison]] are not recommended. The "Kill a [[zombie]] in the [[Draynor Sewers]]" task can also be completed using a Dwarf Multicannon and spawn manipulation. You can then use [[rings of recoil]] for the zombie's remaining hitpoints. An alternative, Ironman friendly, method to kill the zombie includes spawn manipulation using a Dwarf Multicannon and then using an alt account to apply [[poison]] through the use of [[emerald bolts (e)]]. Emerald bolts (e) have of the ability of the [[Magical Poison]] effect triggering on a successful 0 hit. ''Note: When using a Dwarf Multicannon it is recommended to kill a zombie in the southern most room.'' A third alternative method is simply hit the zombie for 1 (gaining minimal combat experience) and recoiling/poisoning.</ref>

*[[Varrock Diary]]

*[[Kourend Diary|Kourend & Kebos Diary]] [Combat [[XP]]]  <ref group="Diary">[[Kourend Diary|Kourend & Kebos Diary]] (Easy) completion REQUIRES combat experience. The "Kill a [[sand crab]]" task cannot be completed using spawn manipulation and requires 1 "true" damage. Sand crabs have 60 [[hitpoints]] and despawn very quickly (after 2-3 minutes) making them rather hard to kill with just [[rings of recoil]]. It is recommended to use an [[alt account]] with a [[Toxic Blowpipe]] and [[Serpentine Helm]] ([[Range]] level reduced to 0-2 with [[Saradomin Brew]]s) to hit a 1 inflicting [[venom]]. The sand crab will then need to regenerate it's hitpoints to full before the venom damage registers (resetting kill credit). Once the sand crabs hitpoints are full, do 1 "true" damage with the Skill Pure (gaining minimal combat experience) while the venom finishes the kill. ''Note: If the venom registers before the sand crab regenerates it's hitpoints to full just start the process over.'' An alternative method is to use a [[poison]]ed weapon to hit the sand crab for 1 (gaining minimal combat experience) and recoiling. ''Note: This method requires the poison to take effect.''</ref>

==Strategies==
Certain non-combat [[skills]] help skill pures in [[Combat]], specifically defending. These skills are extremely helpful and recommended to be trained.
{| class="wikitable" border="0" cellpadding="1" cellspacing="1" style="margin: 0px auto; width: 500px;"
|-
!Skill
!Uses
|-
|[[Slayer]]
|Gives access to more equipment. (The [[bug lantern]] is unlocked at 33 [[Slayer]].)
|-
|[[Agility]]
|Reduces energy usage rate, for quests with monsters on paths.
|}

Some skill pures also have a set-up when doing [[quests]] or activities involving combat. Here's a common one that keeps the items up to three to prevent losing items.

{| class="wikitable" border="0" cellpadding="1" cellspacing="1" style="width: 500px; margin: 0px auto;"
|-
!Slot(s)
!Equipment used
|-
|Main hand
|Any [[bow]] (without ammo, prevents combat)
|-
|Boots
|[[Boots of lightness]] (reduces weight)
|-
|All but weapon, shield, ring slots
|[[Graceful outfit]] (reduces weight, set effect increases run energy restore rate)
|-
|Ring
|[[Ring of recoil]] (deals damage to enemies)
|}
